reviewText: Seeing as only the cardio workouts are the hardest in the series for me, I wasn't expecting too much from this yoga DVD.  I am an advanced workout person so I did level 2.  I barely sweated and didn't feel like I got much of a workout.  This must be for beginners.  Also, did I miss workout #4?

This is a great video!  I am on a weight loss program and have been practicing yoga for 2 years.  I have had to make some modifications in my practice but over time I have progressed.  This video is good for a beginner or advanced athlete, and is very similar to my practice with my instructor here at home.  Yet both of these workouts still offers some challenges for me.  Bob's instruction is very good and he does emphasize and explain the correct positions throughout the workouts.  I recommend this and love the practice of yoga!!  Thank you Bob this is great!!

Challenging, fun and just the right length. And Bob give such nice and easy instruction. This is more challenging than Bob's Biggest Loser yoga workout, which I also enjoyed. I like how he combines athleticism and strength with more traditional yoga - for example with knee bends, planks, sit-ups and crunches. I'll be looking for some of his other "Skinny Rules" DVDs, too.

I like that there are 2/ 30-minute workouts. The first workout is similar to his "Warrior Yoga" moves. I didn't think it was a "beginner" yoga workout, though. I've done yoga for about a year, and found it adequately challenging, but I think someone brand new to yoga would have a harder time.

I love Bob Harper's workout DVDs and bought all of them.  However, I am quite disappointed with these five new ones.  He changed the format.  All other DVDs, especially the Inside Out Method ones, truly deserve 5 stars.
Bob Harper is the best, still the best.
I thought this dvd was great!! I've done a little bit of Yoga but I'm definitely not advanced and was still able to get thru both workouts.
Love his yoga dvds but the hour long first one is my favorite.
I am very much a beginner to Yoga and this CD is not for beginners, I couldn't do most of it.
I am a huge Bob Harper fan and this DVD lives up to my expectations. There are some Yoga moves on the DVD that were new to me so that keeps it interesting and challengin.
